intro: Humboltia hartwegii, commonly known as the desert holly, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features small, spiny leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Its woody structure and drought tolerance make it well adapted to harsh desert conditions. Humboltia hartwegii is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soils and withstand extreme temperature fluctuations.
